Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos with trace of rim; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim (now lost), glazed streaky brown below; part of a lotus flower in added white outline with centre in added red; exterior, slip partly worn, reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: There is a number (6 or 9, probably only) written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd, but the areas is somewhat obscured by the registration number.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 170, no. 208)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 732, no. 928)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1945) (phase 2)
